org.pepppt.core.ble.aggregation

Class Aggregator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepppt.core.ble.aggregation.Aggregator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the concrete type of the identifier that measurements are associated to.

    public class Aggregator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the measurement aggregator. The aggregator will calculate following values:
    • Number of measurements that have benn aggregated AggregationResult.AggregationData.getCountOfObservations()
    • Mean of RSSI values AggregationResult.AggregationData.getMeanRssi()
    • Variance of RSSI values AggregationResult.AggregationData.getRssiVariance()
    • Mean of TX Level Values AggregationResult.AggregationData.getMeanTxLevel()
    • Mean of TX Correction Level values AggregationResult.AggregationData.getMeanTxCorrectionLevel()

    Example: call process after each measurement 

       
      final Aggregator<UUID> aggregator = new Aggregator<>();
      aggregator.submit(new Measurement<>(UUID.randomUUID(), System.nanoTime(), -83, -7, 10));
      aggregator.submit(new Measurement<>(UUID.randomUUID(), System.nanoTime(), -77, -7, -10));

      for (final AggregationResult<UUID> result : aggregator.process()) {
          final long startTime = result.getTimeNanosStart();
          final Map<UUID, AggregationResult.AggregationData> aggregatedData = result.getData();

          for (final Map.Entry<UUID, AggregationResult.AggregationData> entry : aggregatedData.entrySet()) {
              final UUID senderId = entry.getKey();
              final int rssiVariance = entry.getValue().getRssiVariance();
              final int meanRssi = entry.getValue().getMeanRssi();
              final int meanTxLevel = entry.getValue().getMeanTxLevel();
              final int meanTxCorrectionLevel = entry.getValue().getMeanTxCorrectionLevel();

              //store it, e.g.: storeInDatabase(startTime, senderId, rssiVariance, meanRssi, meanTxLevel, meanTxCorrectionLevel);
          }
      }

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Aggregator()
      Creates a new measurement aggregator that will operate with a default time window of 10 seconds.
      Aggregator(int aggregationTime, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Creates a new measurement aggregator that will operate with the given aggregation time and time unit.

      Batch aggregation.
      java.util.List<AggregationResult<T>> process()
      Process all data in the queue that lies in a completed aggregation interval.
      java.util.List<AggregationResult<T>> process(long currentTimeNanos)
      Same as process(), but process all intervals that are completed until the given time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aggregator

        public Aggregator()
        Creates a new measurement aggregator that will operate with a default time window of 10 seconds.

      • Aggregator

        public Aggregator(int aggregationTime,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Creates a new measurement aggregator that will operate with the given aggregation time and time unit.
        Parameters:
        aggregationTime - the size of the aggregation time window, must be > 0.
        timeUnit - the time unit for the aggregation time window

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        public boolean submit(Measurement<T> measurement)
        Submits the specified measurement data to the aggregator.
        Parameters:
        measurement - the measurement to be submitted for aggregation
        Returns:
        true when the data was submitted successfully; false otherwise

      • process

        public java.util.List<AggregationResult<T>> process()
        Process all data in the queue that lies in a completed aggregation interval.
        Returns:
        a list with an entry for each aggregation interval that is completed until now.

      • process

        public java.util.List<AggregationResult<T>> process(long currentTimeNanos)
        Same as process(), but process all intervals that are completed until the given time.
        Parameters:
        currentTimeNanos - the latest interval end time that is processed.
        Returns:
        a list with an entry for each aggregation interval that is completed until now.

      • aggregate

        public static <T> AggregationResult<T> aggregate(java.util.List<Measurement<T>> measurements)
        Batch aggregation. Aggregates the given list of measurements directly into an aggregation result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the concrete type of the identifier
        Parameters:
        measurements - the list of measurements to be aggregated
        Returns:
        the aggregated data
